title.english: Kyo Kara Maoh! - God (?) Save Our King!

description:
Yuri Shibuya was living a pretty normal life. That changed the day he was dunked into a toilet after an attempt to save a classmate from a gang of bullies. Instead of just getting a good soaking, he's pulled in. The next thing he knows, he's in a world that vaguely resembles medieval Europe. If that's not odd enough, he's told that he is to be the next Maoh, just because he has black hair and black eyes. The Maoh is the King of the Mazoku, who are coexisting not-so-peacefully with the humans in this world. Much to his subjects' dismay, he's totally different from the rulers they're accustomed to. He's kind, considerate, a believer in justice, and not willing to use violence to solve conflicts. Not exactly someone they want running a country on the very brink of war. Now, Yuri has to deal with trying to become a good Maoh, while at the same time attempting to adapt to this lands' customs and culture, all in a world where the tension between the humans and Mazoku is reaching its peak.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/temari_ma) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2155584)

She illustrates light novels and is also a writer of yaoi manga. 

She got her pen name from a popular item made in the city she is from. Matsumoto, Nagano Prefecture is known for making temari (a ball used in a traditional Japanese game).
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirumodake)

After graduating from an animation school she was working on many productions for Yumeta Company and Studio Deen.

Married to [Tetsuya Yanagisawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109785/).

Junji Nishimura is a male Japanese director, an episode director and storyboarder from Yobuko, Saga, Japan, though he currently resides in Karatsu, Saga. After graduating from Meiji Gakuin University in 1980, Nishimura entered into the anime studio Nishiko Production. Nishimura had his first job as an episode director for Baldios in 1980, and went on to be an episode director in other series such as Six God Combination Godmars, and Magical Princess Minky Momo in 1982. In 1984, he resigned from Nishiko and in 1985 had his director debut with Pro Golfer Saru. Since then, he has worked as the director on many anime produced by Studio Deen and later on for Seven Arcs.

Bon’Z is a 4-Member J-Rock band under the Universal Music Japan Label. The band was formed by Shun Jinkou (Guitar, vocals), Kazuki Kotaka (Guitar), Shougo Oota (Keyboard) and Shunya Shigemura (Guitar, chorus). The band minorly debuted at October 27, 2004 with their indies album "seed -tane-" but had a major debut in July 27, 2005 with their album "Arigatou~", which is used as the 2nd Ending of Kyou Kara Maoh!
